paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the c.A2987T (N996I) mutation in the KCNH2 gene associated with long-QT syndrome, detailing its functional effects and penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Dermal fibroblasts were obtained from a 38-year-old woman with a diagnosis of familial type-2 LQTS.

functional_data.summary: The N996I KCNH2 mutation causes a significant reduction in IKr and prolongs action potential duration in cardiomyocytes.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation is present in a patient diagnosed with familial type-2 LQTS.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the pathogenic mechanism of the N996I mutation in the context of long-QT syndrome.
key_quotes: Our results demonstrated that the c.A2987T KCNH2 mutation is the primary cause of the LQTS phenotype.
The N996I mutation appears to interfere with the maturation and trafficking of the channel to the membrane.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on a single variant in the KCNH2 gene.
